meanings.sent1: The unsworn witness was not legally bound to tell the truth.
meanings.sent2: The detective found an unsworn statement that had not been sworn under oath.
meanings.sent3: The unsworn chicken promised not to eat the farmer's crops.
meanings.sent4: The unsworn promise hung in the air, unconfirmed and uncertain.
meanings.sent5: The unsworn path led to a mysterious destination, untouched by vows.

meanings.definition: Not having made a solemn declaration.
meanings.sent1: The unsworn document lacked the gravity of a solemn declaration.
meanings.sent2: The unsworn testimony was not as impactful as a solemnly declared statement.
meanings.sent3: The unsworn cat declared it would only drink milk on Sundays.
meanings.sent4: The unsworn clouds floated lazily in the sky, without a serious declaration of rain.
meanings.sent5: The unsworn promise danced lightly in the wind, without the weight of a solemn declaration.

meanings.sent1: The unsworn official had not pledged to uphold the law.
meanings.sent2: The unsworn ceremony did not involve the participants swearing an oath.
meanings.sent3: The unsworn squirrel promised not to steal any nuts from the tree.
meanings.sent4: The unsworn bond between them was strong, even without a formal oath.
meanings.sent5: The unsworn contract floated between them, lacking the binding power of an oath.
